title: Boston firefighters battle 2-alarm blaze at multi-family home in Dorchester
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston Fire Department extinguished a two-alarm fire at a multi-family home at 25 Train St. in Dorchester.
The fire, starting at 8:30 a.m., displaced two residents and caused $500,000 in damages.
One firefighter was hospitalized, and the cause of the fire remains under investigation.

title: Here’s what Jon Stewart had to say about the Senate Democrats voting to end the shutdown
author: John Waller
bullets: Jon Stewart criticized Senate Democrats, calling their decision to end the shutdown a 'world class collapse.'
The Senate Democrats voted to take steps towards ending the federal government shutdown, drawing widespread attention.
The legislation to conclude the shutdown has become a focal point in political discussions following the Senate vote.

title: Patrice Bergeron was asked about possible 2026 Hall of Fame induction
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Patrice Bergeron was asked about his potential Hockey Hall of Fame induction in 2026 but remained humble in his response.
Bergeron, who retired in 2023 after 19 seasons with the Bruins, is a six-time Selke Trophy winner and three-time NHL All-Star.
At a Hall of Fame event, Bergeron supported former teammates Zdeno Chara and Joe Thornton, emphasizing their impact on his career.

title: Boston police ask for help in search for missing 15-year-old
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston police are searching for 15-year-old Briyana Jacques, last seen in Dorchester near Ashmont station on Saturday.
Briyana Jacques is described as a Black female, 5'5", with brown hair with blonde highlights and a nose piercing.
Authorities urge anyone with information on Jacques' whereabouts to contact Boston police at 617-343-4712.

title: Struggling military families ask Globe Santa for help
author: Linda Matchan
bullets: Military families are increasingly turning to Globe Santa for holiday gift assistance due to financial hardships.
Economic challenges for military families include high living costs, childcare expenses, and the impact of government shutdowns.
Globe Santa, a 70-year program, offers gifts to children in need, accepting donations by phone, mail, or online.

title: Here’s what Boston meteorologists are saying about Tuesday’s wind chill, potential for flurries
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Weather forecasts predict unseasonably cold and windy conditions for Boston, with potential flurries and snow showers, especially in the Berkshires.
Wind chills will remain in the 20s on Veterans Day, with winds gusting over 30 mph and temperatures reaching just 35-40°F.
The chilly pattern is expected to continue through the weekend, with possible rain and a wintry mix north of Route 2 on Sunday.

title: Love Letters notes on Veterans Day
author: Meredith Goldstein
bullets: The Love Letters column recognizes Veterans Day as an observed holiday and takes the day off.
A contest is announced for Elin Hilderbrand fans to attend a special Globe event with Meredith Goldstein.
The latest Love Letters podcast features a discussion with longtime sports columnist Christopher L. Gasper.

title: After loss to Warren, Republican John Deaton announces another run for Senate
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Republican John Deaton announces his candidacy for U.S. Senate against Democrat Ed Markey in Massachusetts.
Deaton, a Marine veteran and personal injury lawyer, previously ran against Sen. Elizabeth Warren in 2024.
Deaton emphasizes addressing rising costs and critiquing career politicians in his campaign video.

title: What will the Red Sox target this offseason? Craig Breslow maps out Boston’s priorities.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox aim to add a top pitcher to support ace Garrett Crochet during the offseason, considering both trades and free agency.
Boston is exploring options to strengthen their lineup power, with potential targets like Kyle Schwarber and Pete Alonso.
Chief baseball officer Craig Breslow emphasizes balancing immediate contention with future considerations in trades and signings.

title: Zdeno Chara’s 10 most memorable moments with the Bruins
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Zdeno Chara served as captain of the Boston Bruins for 14 seasons, helping to win a Stanley Cup in 2011.
Chara was inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame, celebrating his contributions to the Bruins and the sport overall.
He holds the NHL record for hardest shot at 108.8 mph and won a Norris Trophy in 2009.
